intro: Notopleura altsonii, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by distinctive, winged fruits. Its botanical features include the presence of calcium oxalate crystals in its tissues, which are common in the Menispermaceae family. Notopleura altsonii is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and thickets.
